verses.kjv: Ho, every one that thirsteth, come ye to the waters, and he that hath no money; come ye, buy, and eat; yea, come, buy wine and milk without money and without price.
verses.ct: "Come, everyone who is thirsty — come to the water! And you who have no money — come, buy food and eat! Come, get wine and milk at no cost, completely free!"

verses.kjv: Wherefore do ye spend money for that which is not bread? and your labour for that which satisfieth not? hearken diligently unto me, and eat ye that which is good, and let your soul delight itself in fatness.
verses.ct: "Why do you spend your money on what isn't really food? Why do you work hard for what never satisfies? Listen carefully to me, and you will eat what is truly good, and your soul will feast on the richest nourishment."

verses.kjv: Incline your ear, and come unto me: hear, and your soul shall live; and I will make an everlasting covenant with you, even the sure mercies of David.
verses.ct: "Pay attention and come to me. Listen, and your soul will live. I will establish an eternal covenant with you — the faithful promises I made to David."

verses.kjv: Behold, I have given him for a witness to the people, a leader and commander to the people.
verses.ct: "Look, I appointed him as a witness to the nations, a leader and commander over peoples."

verses.kjv: Behold, thou shalt call a nation that thou knowest not, and nations that knew not thee shall run unto thee because of the LORD thy God, and for the Holy One of Israel; for he hath glorified thee.
verses.ct: "Look, you will summon nations you don't know, and nations that have never known you will rush to you — because of the LORD your God, the Holy One of Israel, who has honored you with glory."

verses.kjv: Seek ye the LORD while he may be found, call ye upon him while he is near:
verses.ct: Search for the LORD while he can still be found. Call out to him while he is near.

verses.kjv: Let the wicked forsake his way, and the unrighteous man his thoughts: and let him return unto the LORD, and he will have mercy upon him; and to our God, for he will abundantly pardon.
verses.ct: The wicked person should abandon their way of living, and the unrighteous person should abandon their thoughts. Let them turn back to the LORD, and he will show them mercy. Let them return to our God, because he forgives generously.

verses.kjv: For my thoughts are not your thoughts, neither are your ways my ways, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "My thoughts are not your thoughts, and your ways are not my ways," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: For as the heavens are higher than the earth, so are my ways higher than your ways, and my thoughts than your thoughts.
verses.ct: "Just as the heavens are higher than the earth, so my ways are higher than your ways, and my thoughts are higher than your thoughts."

verses.kjv: For as the rain cometh down, and the snow from heaven, and returneth not thither, but watereth the earth, and maketh it bring forth and bud, that it may give seed to the sower, and bread to the eater:
verses.ct: "Just as rain and snow fall from the heavens and don't return there without first soaking the earth, making it sprout and grow so it produces seed for the farmer and food for the hungry —"

verses.kjv: So shall my word be that goeth forth out of my mouth: it shall not return unto me void, but it shall accomplish that which I please, and it shall prosper in the thing whereto I sent it.
verses.ct: "that is how my word will be when it goes out from my mouth. It will not come back to me empty. Instead, it will achieve what I intended and succeed in the purpose I sent it for."

verses.kjv: For ye shall go out with joy, and be led forth with peace: the mountains and the hills shall break forth before you into singing, and all the trees of the field shall clap their hands.
verses.ct: "You will leave with joy and be guided along in peace. The mountains and hills will burst into song in front of you, and all the trees of the countryside will clap their hands."

verses.kjv: Instead of the thorn shall come up the fir tree, and instead of the brier shall come up the myrtle tree: and it shall be to the LORD for a name, for an everlasting sign that shall not be cut off.
verses.ct: "Cypress trees will grow where thornbushes once stood, and myrtle trees will replace briars. This will serve as a tribute to the LORD's reputation — an everlasting sign that will never be destroyed."
